meanings.definition: A drug used to treat glaucoma by reducing intraocular pressure.
meanings.sent1: The doctor prescribed pilocarpine to help lower the pressure in my eyes.
meanings.sent2: My grandmother uses pilocarpine eye drops to manage her glaucoma.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally mistook the pilocarpine for regular eye drops and ended up with dilated pupils!
meanings.sent4: The pilocarpine worked like a charm, melting away the tension in my eyes like ice on a hot day.
meanings.sent5: As the pilocarpine seeped into my eyes, I felt a soothing relief wash over me.

meanings.sent2: The pharmacy sourced high-quality pilocarpine for their new eye drop formula.

meanings.sent4: The aroma of the pilocarpine-infused potion filled the room, transporting me to a tropical forest.
meanings.sent5: The pilocarpine gleamed under the microscope, revealing its intricate molecular structure.

meanings.definition: A medication that stimulates the parasympathetic nervous system.
meanings.sent1: The pilocarpine injection quickly activated my parasympathetic nervous system.
meanings.sent2: Athletes sometimes use pilocarpine to enhance their performance by stimulating their nervous system.
meanings.sent3: After taking pilocarpine, I couldn't stop laughing at the silliest jokes!

meanings.sent5: The pilocarpine rush made me feel alive, as if my body was dancing to its own beat.
